definitions: To prevent (a pilot or an aircraft) from flying.
To prohibit (a ship or boat) from sailing.
To run (a ship or boat) aground.
To base (something) on firm ground or a sound reason.
To teach (someone) the basics or fundamentals of a subject.
To connect (an electrical circuit) to the earth.
To punish (a child or young person) by restricting their activities and privileges.
examples: The airline grounded all its planes.
The captain grounded the vessel in the shallow water.
His argument was grounded in solid research.
She was well grounded in mathematics.
My parents grounded me for a month.
